heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 4.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 36.8mm.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes is 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

storm.status: No storm activity at the moment.  The previous storm occurred on 26 October 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is south-westerly (209°).  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: 1737 miles is the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description: Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 3.8°C), outside temperature (up 3.7°C), and inside temperature (up 2.0°C) and drier conditions in outside humidity (down 6%) and rainfall (down 0.2 mm).

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; pleasant, mild temperatures. Also, neither too dry nor too humid and calm and still conditions are expected. Chance of light rain, mostly clear skies with high cloud, and bright intervals likely. Changeable conditions.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (93%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
